mdRecord.dcterms:title: Virginia Quarterly Review
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Thompson, Ralph R.
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: From excerpt: First change in editors of the Virginia Quarterly Review was made in 1930. In this group, taken in front of Hotel A on West Range where the journals offices have been since 1929, are, left to right, Stringfellow Barr, then professor of history and the second editor, University President Edwin A. Alderman, Dr. James Southall Wilson, the first editor, who has continued ever since as a member of the advisory board, and Lambert Davis, the first managing editor, now director of the University of North Carolina Press.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Visual History Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: University of Virginia
